isis.stitle: TSI 00-08-07 - Auto Neutral Circuit Revision for 2000 and 4000 Models Built Between November 1, 1997 and April 3, 2000 with Allison WTEC III Transmissions, International Code 813AAS

subjectgroup.subject: Auto Neutral Circuit Revision for 2000 and 4000 Models Built Between November 1, 1997 and April 3, 2000 with Allison WTEC III Transmissions, International Code 813AAS

geninfo.para: 2000 and 4000 Models Built Between November 1, 1997 and April 3, 2000 with Allison WTEC III Transmissions, International Code 813AAS, have a circuit configuration that may not ramp-up engine RPM's for PTO operation when the Auto-Neutral feature is turned on and the parking brake switch is on.

To assure Auto-Neutral functionality, a circuit modification was implemented in production on April 3, 2000. Vehicles produced prior to this date can be modified following the Service Procedure provided.

svcproc.title: Service Procedure

warning.para: Batteries expel explosive gases. Keep sparks, flames, burning cigarettes or other ignition sources away at all times. Always wear safety glasses and a face shield when working near batteries to prevent personal injury.

svcproc.para: Refer to circuit diagram, Figure 1 , for existing circuit configuration and Figure 2 for the modification to current production.

step1.para: Disconnect the battery cable from the negative terminal.
Locate the neutral indicator relay (962) (Figure 1 and Figure 2).
Remove jumper wire 146F located between relay terminals 85 and 30.

Move circuit 114NO to terminal 30 on neutral indicator relay (962).Splice into circuit 114NO at terminal 30 on neutral indicator relay with 18 gauge wire (Figure 1) and make a connection to connector 386, terminal B (Figure 2).
Install a 16 gauge jumper wire between terminals 87 and 85 on the neutral indicator relay (Figure 2). Insure that circuit 146E is still connected to terminal 85 or 87 of the neutral indicator relay.
Install a 14 gauge jumper wire from terminal 87A on the neutral indicator relay to terminal 87 on the neutral relay (Figure 2 and Figure 3).
Reconnect the negative battery cable to the battery.

item.para: Place the vehicle in a safe surrounding, away from other parked vehicles, buildings and people. Start the vehicle, place the gear selector in drive and place the auto-neutral switch to the on position. Verify that the transmission shifts into neutral and proper PTO operation is available when the parking brake is set.

Use the throttle pedal to increase the engine speed from idle to approximately 1200 RPM. Release the parking brake and verify that the transmission does not shift into gear. Bring the engine RPM back to idle, move the gear selector from drive into neutral, then back into drive and verify that the transmission now shifts into gear.
With the gear selector still in drive, turn the engine off. Verify that the engine cannot be re-started until the gear selector is moved back into the neutral position.

svcsubproc.title: Auto-Neutral Indicator Light
svcsubproc.para: The auto-neutral indicator light will be ON for the following conditions:

item.para: The gear selector is in the neutral position.
During Auto-Neutral operation with the gear selector in drive and the transmission is in neutral.
If the engine stalls during Auto-Neutral operation, the gear selector must be moved to the neutral position to re-start the engine.
Set parking brake: ties circuits 161C and 117 through park brake connector 466 and transmission spare I/O terminals B and C.
Auto-Neutral switch ON: grounds circuit 153 through park brake connector 466 and transmission spare I/O terminal E.
Transmission in neutral: circuit 114 on connector 466 and transmission spare I/O terminal F will go to ground by command of the transmission ECU.

note.para: If the engine stalls this input will open releasing the neutral indicator relay.

item.para: PTO operation: With circuit 114 grounded, the neutral indicator relay will be actuated, applying 12 volts to the DDC circuit on the engine ECM and the neutral indicator light will come ON. This will allow normal PTO operation.

svcsubproc.title: Transmission Will Not Shift into Neutral while the Engine is Running

item.para: With the Auto-Neutral switch in the on position and the park brake on, check continuity between terminals B and C on the transmission spare I/O connector 466. If there is no continuity between the terminals check for correct park brake operation and the connecting circuits.
Verify that terminal E on transmission spare I/O connector 466 is grounded. If the terminal is not grounded, check for proper operation of the Auto-Neutral ON/OFF switch and ground circuits.
Verify that terminal F on transmission spare I/O connector 466 is grounded. If the terminal is not grounded, check for correct grounding of the Allison transmission ECU or ECU malfunction.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Will Not Crank
svcsubproc.para: The transmission gear selector must be in the neutral position.

item.para: Check for 12 volts at the engine (ECM) connector 379 ( Figure 4), between terminal 26 (DDS) to ground and terminal 46 (ECI) to ground.

With the gear selector in the neutral position and the key in the run position, check circuit 123 on the Allison "V" connector for 12 volts. If the voltage is 0.0 check the transmission ECU for correct power and ground feeds.
Check fuse F17, circuit 97P from fuse F17 to the neutral relay and operation of neutral relay (615).

note.para: For the engine to crank, 12 volts must be present at the engine ECU DDS input on connector 379.

Circuit 123 on Allison ECU "V" connector 632 will only have 12 volts present whenever the transmission gear selector is in the neutral position. This will actuate the neutral relay, applying 12 volts to circuit 97AV through circuit 97A to the engine ECU DDS input and allow the engine to crank.
